definitions.definition: the liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables; a drink made from this

examples.text: Add the juice of two lemons.
Sprinkle the avocado slices with lemon juice.
the grated rind and juice of two lemons

definitions.definition: the liquid that comes out of a piece of meat when it is cooked

examples.text: Use the juices of the meat to make gravy.

definitions.definition: the liquid in the stomach that helps you to digest food

examples.text: My phone has run out of juice.

definitions.definition: power to influence people or influence what happens

examples.text: She has a lot of juice with city hall.
He had been on the juice all weekend and was in a bad way.

definitions.definition: anabolic steroids (= chemical substances taken by people to increase the size of their muscles)
a liquid containing nicotine that is used in a device for vaping

examples.text: The shelves are now full of vape pens and juices.
He needed some juice for his vape.

definitions.definition: to leave somebody to worry and suffer the unpleasant effects of their own actions

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin jus ‘broth, vegetable juice’.
